intro_text: The patrol wants to hold a training session for app1. They decide to focus on how best to navigate the rocky tide pools.
decline_text: They decide to focus on patrolling the territory instead. Training can wait for another day.

success_outcomes.text: app1 listens carefully as p_l explains where to find the best prey within the rich waters of the pools.
app1 picks up the instruction quickly and is soon hopping from pool to pool, picking out the tasty morsels within.
By the end of the patrol, s_c is easily fishing fresh-kill out of the pools with not an ounce of hesitation in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} movements.

fail_outcomes.text: app1 tries to remember the differences and nuances between the creatures within the pools, but fails to retain any of the information.
s_c struggles to take the lesson seriously and eventually the training session ends early with no real progress made.
app1 tries to poke around in the pools for potential food. Ouch! Oops, that was a sea urchin. app1 limps the whole way home.

history_text.scar: m_c got spiked by a sea urchin while training as an apprentice.

p_l digs through the sand, helping r_c clear it away enough for the other cat to scramble free.

Without letting {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} panic, s_c carefully assesses the collapsed dune trapping {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Clanmate. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/point/points} out stable footing for the patrol to dig {PRONOUN/r_c/object} out from above, and r_c is recovered, scared but okay.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol works all day to free r_c and gets nothing else done.

intro_text: p_l takes them both out to see a big octopus a patrol spotted in one of c_n's rockpools.
decline_text: When they get there, they can't find it, and the lesson fails.

success_outcomes.text: app1 watches the massive creature the tides have washed in with wide eyes, tail twitching with excitement. p_l tries to point out the hooked beak, as the octopus lazily waves a tentacle ever so temptingly just under the surface of the water.

p_l tries to point out the hooked beak, as the octopus lazily waves a tentacle ever so temptingly just under the surface of the water. app1 flinches backwards as the creature suddenly lunges after a little fish. Once it's disappeared into the suddenly scary beak, the octopus goes back to swaying like harmless kelp.

s_c points out the dangers of the creature, explaining how some c_n stories tell of a Dark Forest cat who tried to escape into the ocean, only to be cursed by StarClan into becoming a monster, with legs sprouting from each claw. As app1 watches the octopus contort itself, more liquid than animal, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} can see how it could be a sea cat.

fail_outcomes.text: app1 maintains that octopus are prey, not opponents or weird transformed dead cats or anything like that, just prey, and p_l can't get {PRONOUN/app1/object} to take the training session seriously.

intro_text: It's storming in c_n's territory today, and app1 waits for app2 up on one of the cliffs.
decline_text: The apprentices are called back to camp to deal with an elder's wet bedding.

success_outcomes.text: app2 wanders carefully up the cliff path, asking what app1 wanted to show {PRONOUN/app2/object}. app1 brings {PRONOUN/app2/object} to a point where the wind hits the land, and app2 gasps, watching the gigantic waves breaking against the cliff. It's thrilling and a little scary and very cool.

When app2 arrives, app1 shows {PRONOUN/app2/object} the spot {PRONOUN/app1/subject}{VERB/app1/'ve/'s} found, where the apprentices can see the gigantic storm waves breaking against the land. Both of them gasp when a thunderbolt hits out to sea, throwing the world into black and white, pressed up safely against each other, warmed by the other's pelt.

app2 rounds the top of the cliff and sees s_c, asking why s_c wanted to meet there. Stuttering but determined, s_c explains that {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} wondered if, possibly, maybe, app2 would like to go on a... date? app2 looks away with a purr and murmurs a soft yes to the ground, suddenly unable to make eye contact. They watch the storm together, quietly thrilled.

fail_outcomes.text: app2 rounds the top of the cliff, and seeing app1, asks why app1 wanted to meet there. app1 stutters out some nonsense about hunting, and then runs off into the rain.

intro_text: app1 and app2 wanders on a sandy beach near camp.
decline_text: The apprentices are called back to camp to help watch camp.

success_outcomes.text: app2 drapes {PRONOUN/app1/object} with a bunch of seaweed, and proclaims {PRONOUN/app1/subject} clothed like a Twoleg. {PRONOUN/app2/subject/CAP} {VERB/app2/chase/chases} after app1, who's not as keen to get seaweed slime all over {PRONOUN/app1/self}, and the two young cats play on the safe sands all afternoon.

app1 finds a gigantic and flawless shell that's washed up on the beach with last night's tide and calls app2 over. Both apprentices startle backwards when a hermit crab starts scurrying away from them. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/chase/chases} it, shouting joyfully, eyes wide and silly as the poor hermit crab has to wait until {PRONOUN/app1/subject} finally get bored to escape.

app1 finds a shell that shines with a brilliant internal sheen. Picking it up, {PRONOUN/app1/subject} shyly present it to app2, wondering if app2 might like it for {PRONOUN/app2/poss} nest. Blushing to the tips of {PRONOUN/app2/poss} ears, app2 accepts {PRONOUN/app1/poss} gift.

fail_outcomes.text: app1 tries to give app2 a shell, but {PRONOUN/app2/subject} {VERB/app2/do/does}n't want it, and the crestfallen apprentice slinks off sadly.

intro_text: p_l approaches r_c, asking if {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} wouldn't mind showing p_l {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} hunting techniques, and perhaps doing some training with {PRONOUN/r_c/object}?
decline_text: r_c declines gently, explaining that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/haves} too much work to do.

success_outcomes.text: The cats go out together in the late of the day, as the gulls fly home to roost. r_c goes through {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} tricks, showing p_l how {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/use/uses} the direction of the sun to avoid casting a shadow on pools as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/fish/fishes}, as p_l watches with eyes that r_c notices are a bit too admiring for what's just a little trick. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/smirk/smirks}, showing off a little.

It's a long but satisfying training session, with both cats having an in depth chance to test {PRONOUN/r_c/object} and work on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} skills. It ends with {PRONOUN/r_c/object} both sitting on a little outlook, watching the sun go down and catching the last of its rays on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} pelts. r_c sees p_l watching {PRONOUN/r_c/object} instead of the sun, and smiles.

s_c is a fantastic hunter, and p_l isn't shy about telling {PRONOUN/p_l/object} so. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/blush/blushes}, but work through it, showing p_l how to use the scraps of old crowfood from the fresh-kill pile to attract crabs and fish in the rockpools out of {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} hidey-holes.

p_l marvels at the opportunity to have s_c's time to {PRONOUN/p_l/self}. s_c is such a popular cat, so friendly and fun to be around, and yet when the training session draws to a close under the setting sun, s_c looks surprised to be told so.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c spots p_l looking at {PRONOUN/r_c/object} a little bit too admiringly, and ends the training session early, diplomatically making up an excuse.

intro_text: p_l approaches r_c, asking if {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} wouldn't mind showing p_l {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} hunting techniques, and perhaps doing some training with {PRONOUN/p_l/object}?
decline_text: r_c declines gently, explaining that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} too much work to do.

success_outcomes.text: The cats go out together in the late of the day, as the gulls fly home to roost. r_c goes through {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} tricks, showing p_l how {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/use/uses} the direction of the sun to avoid casting a shadow on pools as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/fish/fishes}, as p_l watches with eyes that r_c notices are a bit too admiring for what's just a little trick. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/smirk/smirks}, showing off a little.

It's a long but satisfying training session, with both cats having an in depth chance to test themselves and work on their skills. It ends with them both sitting on a little outlook, watching the sun go down and catching the last of its rays on their pelts. r_c sees p_l watching {PRONOUN/r_c/object} instead of the sun, and smiles.

s_c is a fantastic hunter, and p_l isn't shy about telling {PRONOUN/p_l/object} so. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/blush/blushes}, but work through it, showing p_l how to use the scraps of old crowfood from the fresh-kill pile to attract crabs and fish in the rockpools out of their hidey-holes.

p_l marvels at the opportunity to have s_c's time to {PRONOUN/p_l/self}. s_c is such a popular cat, so friendly and fun to be around, and yet when the training session draws to a close under the setting sun, s_c looks surprised to be told so.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c tries, but both the cats are too tired after a long day's work, and end up snapping at each other. It's nothing serious, but both agree to take some time to cool off.

intro_text: As p_l and r_c wander across the beach with only the stars to light their way, they notice sparkles of light where the waves break upon the shore.
decline_text: A little freaked out, the warriors go to fetch a medicine cat to interpret this omen for them.

success_outcomes.text: r_c pokes curiously at one of the little lights, bringing {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} face down to it. It's a tiny crab, less than the width of one of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} claws! It fascinates {PRONOUN/r_c/object} and p_l, and they spend hours on the beach, lapping up mouthfuls of light crabs and crushing them between their teeth, laughing with each other as their mouths start glowing too.

Stunned, the cats sit back and watch as the waves bring ripples of light. It's a breathless, magical scene, and r_c leans against p_l, their pelts keeping each other warm as they take in the magic of the sea.

As they watch, quiet and patient, more and more of the sea starts to come alive with light, tiny creatures dancing around in the water. With no words other than the occasional quiet gasp, p_l and s_c spend hours watching the magic of the sea swirl and dip and move, their hearts full of wonder.

fail_outcomes.text: They continue on their way, not stopping to see the sights.

intro_text: p_l sees a pod of dolphins swimming in the distance and considers it a good learning opportunity for the apprentices.
decline_text: The weather is turning rough and p_l makes the decision to teach the apprentices about the dolphins another day.

success_outcomes.text: p_l tells a mournful and haunting tale of all the cats that were swept out to sea and drowned before the dolphins took pity on one of them. p_l tells the apprentices that the tiny white and red cat that was saved made the first traditions and bonds with the dolphins and that both Clan and dolphins wept at their death when it came.

p_l tells the apprentices about the red and white cat that was saved by the dolphins, they managed to keep afloat long enough for them to be saved by relaxing their entire body and floating on the waves.

fail_outcomes.text: A sudden storm cuts off p_l's words and the patrol sprints back to camp to get warm and dry.

intro_text: As the cats move along the shoreline, they spot something massive moving beneath the water.
decline_text: The cats are feeling remarkably incurious today.

success_outcomes.text: It's Nessie! The patrol trots up, exchanging a nice mouse for a nice deep water fish, both creatures trading the respective delicacies that're hard for the other to obtain.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol is so wrapped up trying to work out what the creature is that r_c topples into the water. It solves the mystery though, as Nessie propels r_c back onto the shoreline with one gentle, immense flipper.

intro_text: p_l waves r_c over with {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} tail. What's that?!
decline_text: r_c isn't interested, and the patrol continues on their way.

success_outcomes.text: The massive frog-Twoleg creeps up the rocks, slow and unnatural. The patrol watches, breathless, until it's out of sight. Well, p_l huffs. Maybe toads grow bigger than {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} thought. Terrifying.

fail_outcomes.text: Frozen, the cats watch the massive lumbering frog, the size of a Twoleg and just as bipedal. It pauses, and like the rumble of thunder, issues a massive croak that creaks like cracking wood. All r_c can do is shiver.
